main event: A sighting of an unidentified flying object was reported on 15 December 1966 by a civilian observer at APO San Francisco.
interesting points: The object was observed for 3 minutes and was described as oblong in shape that changed from horizontal to vertical., The observer compared the size of the object to be 2 to 3 times larger than a Boeing CT-2 when it appeared., The object was bright white during the observation., The weather was very dark with no moon, which might have influenced visibility., The conclusion was that there was insufficient data for further evaluation.
witness description: Civilian, age 44, air traffic controller for FAA
